titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I met Wright at S. Margaret's & gave him directions for fixing the Arnold–Forster tablet.
The Brotherhood dined with Gow. There were present Benham, Church, Shelford, Morrison, Pearce, Beeching, Gow & myself.

On Thursday, (March 10th, 1910) the Bishop of Kensington administered Confirmation in S. Margaret's. There were 31 candidates presented by me – 13 boys & 18 women & girls. Among the latter was Mary Lyttelton. Her parents came to the service. Candidates were presented from S. Martin's, S. Andrew's, & S. Stephen's.
